intro: Psychotria lamarinensis, commonly known as the Lamarinense Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in local communities for various therapeutic purposes.
